It is characterized by its striking, elongated fruit that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length, making it one of the most distinctive features of the plant. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It is native to South Africa, where it thrives in specific microhabitats with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its rarity and unique morphology, it is of great interest to botanists and plant conservationists.
